lineage.lineage:
Data were collected during the 2015 and 2017 research cruises that occurred on the Norseman II, starting in Prudhoe Bay and ending in Wainwright. 

INSTRUMENT DESCRIPTION: Water samples were collected from rosette bottles attached to a Seabird Model SBE911 CTD. Water column samples collected were analyzed for inorganic nutrient concentrations, oxygen-18/16 ratios of seawater, and chlorophyll a at up to 6 depths at each station from the rosette bottles. Sensor data from the CTD device for temperature, salinity, and depth are also included. Subsamples for inorganic nutrients were collected from the CTD rosette, filtered shipboard (Whatman GFF), and frozen for post cruise analyses.
lineage.environment_description: The data files were originally constructed in Microsoft Excel and exported as csv files for data archive.

sources.description: This dataset, [TITLE], incorporates depth, temperature, salinity, latitude, longitude, and date time values from the CTD device deployed with the Niskin bottons that collected water samples throughout the water column. The complete CTD dataset available, and is cited below.

description.purpose: This dataset aims to characterize the hydrographic conditions of water entering the Chukchi Sea from the Pacific through Bering Strait by measuring temperature, salinity and nutrient content using a Seabird SBE55 CTD. This information provides a reference dataset for evaluating hypotheses that seek mechanistic descriptions of the regional ocean environment and ecosystem.
description.abstract: This dataset contains measurements of water samples collected in the Chukchi Sea during the 9 August - 3 September 2015 and the 4 August - 26 August 2017 Arctic Marine Biodiversity Observing Network (AMBON) research cruises aboard the vessel RV Norseman II. This dataset consists of two comma-separated values (csv) files (named 'AMBON [YYYY] bottle file new_NutrientChlaDelO18.csv) containing measurements of water samples collected by a Niskin bottle array on a Seabird SBE55 CTD at hydrographic stations in each 2015 and 2017. These data files contain chemistry measurements made on bottle samples, including Chlorophyll a Concentration (micro-g/L), and nutrient concentrations [micro-mol/L] (Ammonia, Phosphate, Nitrite+Nitrate, and Silicate). Water samples were also collected for analysis of 18O/16O ratios. The data files also include physical information, depth, salinity and temperature measurements from the CTD at the location of bottle sample collection. Two source CTD ASCII data files (named AMBON[YYYY]_bottles.all) consisting of measurements from the depths at which the Niskin bottles were tripped are also included in this dataset. The data provides information on important Arctic Chuckchi Sea ecosystem parameters, including temperature, salinity, pressure, and fluorescence as an index of phytoplankton biomass.

process_steps.description: Nutrient samples were analyzed at the University of Maryland Center for Environmental Science (UMCES) Nutrient Analytical Services Laboratory (NASL) at the Chesapeake Biological Laboratory, with standard methods documented at http://nasl.cbl.umces.edu. Samples were processed for 4 nutrients: nitrite + nitrate (NO2+NO3), silica (SiO4), phosphate (PO4), and ammonium (NH4).
[CTD processing - subsetting for combining with nutrient data] SETH
[process of combining CTD and nutrient data] ALYNNE

Water samples for 18O/16O ratios were collected in small vials, sealed to prevent evaporation and returned for analysis. These samples are being analyzed at the University of Maryland Center for Environmental Science using a Thermo DeltaPlus Stable Isotope Mass Spectrometer coupled to a Gasbench peripheral. Data are reported in the delta notation relative to Vienna Standard Mean Ocean Water (V-SMOW).

The water column chlorophyll was analyzed shipboard using a Turner Designs AU-20 fluorometer (non-acidification or Welschmeyer method) following a 24-hour in the dark incubation with 90% acetone at 4°C method (see Cooper et al. 2012, 2013 for published details).

Chl-a PROCESSING STEPS CITATIONS:

Cooper, L.W., M.A. Janout, K.E. Frey, R. Pirtle-Levy, M.L. Guarinello, J.M. Grebmeier, and J.R. Lovvorn. 2012. The relationship between sea ice break-up, water mass variation, chlorophyll biomass, and sedimentation in the northern Bering Sea. Deep Sea Research Part II 65‚ 141-162; doi:10.1016/j.dsr2.2012.02.002.

Cooper, L.W, M.G. Sexson, J.M. Grebmeier, R. Gradinger, C.W. Mordy, J.R. Lovvorn. 2013. Linkages Between Sea Ice Coverage, Pelagic-Benthic Coupling and the Distribution of Spectacled Eiders: Observations in March 2008, 2009 and 2010 from the Northern Bering Sea, Deep Sea Research Part II, Topical Studies in Oceanography, 94, 31-43.

supplemental_info.supplemental_info:
Users of AMBON data are encouraged to cross-reference the AMBON master station list file if attempting to spatially align or synthesize data across AMBON study disciplines. The station masterlist contains information about the station identifiers, locations, and bottom depth during the 2015 research cruise. At each station more than one observation or sample type may have occurred by different AMBON researchers during which alternate station names may have been applied. 

These data are made available as a public service and should not be considered final. Please contact the originator for additional information prior to significant use or publication.

table_description.table_name: AMBON Chlorophyll-a, Nutrients, and delta O 18, 2015 2017

attribute_basics.definition: The name of the cruise on which data was collected. In both of the ctd-bottle data files (AMBON[2015|2017]_bottles.all), this column has a single, uniform value - the cruise code for the year, i.e., AMBON2015 or AMBON2017.
This attribute gives the station number of consecutively sampled stations.

Position of the bottle on the rosette at each CTD station. A maximum of 15 bottles were deployed at each station. For each bottle position at each station, there are four rows of data, ordered: average values, standard deviation values, minimum values, and maximum values. The data type for each row is indicated in the final column of the data file.

The date and time the bottle was opened to collect samples. Because date and time are the same for each of the four value types for each bottle, these date time values are understood to apply to all for rows. Date is given in the first row (avg) while time is given in the second row (st dev).

metadata:lineage_statement.label: Lineage Statement
metadata:lineage_statement.help_text: A detailed explanation about how the dataset was constructed, including data collection, transformations, and equipment used. This narrative should provide the entire development history of the dataset from its origin to current form.

examples.value:
The list of evaluation species was created in a series of steps, starting with a comprehensive survey of species of high national importance occurring within USFWS Region 5. This was developed by combining lists of all federally listed Threatened and Endangered species, 'nongame birds of Management Concern', and waterfowl, shorebirds, anadromous and interjurisdictional fishes (inshore species of concern to the USFWS and National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration, NOAA), which have significantly and persistently declined in abundance.
The watershed boundary was constructed by selecting the outer boundaries of all smaller watersheds in Maine, New Hampshire, and Massachusetts that flow into the Gulf of Maine. These watersheds were identified using U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) 1:24,000- and 1:100,000-scale hydrology coverages. The boundary was extended into the Gulf at Cape Cod and eastern Maine.
Atwood et al. (1996) developed a habitat model for Bicknell's thrush and found that occurrences were associated with vegetation, elevation, and latitude. Our model applied the same elevation and, as far as possible, cover type parameters. We also integrated sites of known past occurrences. We selected as 'potential habitat' areas with elevations at or over 3000', based on digital contour maps (Maine) or digital raster graphics (New Hampshire). Lower elevations were regarded as likely to be unsuitable. Bicknell's thrush occurrences in the Northeast are listed by mountain name in Atwood and Rimmer (1994), supplemented with information from Tom Hodgman, Maine Department of Inland Fisheries and Wildlife. These were digitized as point locations. Where 'potential habitat' coincided with observed use, these areas were scored according to their cover type (see http://r5gomp.fws.gov/gom/habitatstudy/metadata/Bicknell's_thrush_model.htm). Point occurrences at lower elevations were buffered 100 m, and these areas also were scored according to cover type. Other areas having elevations lower than 3000' and appropriate cover type, but not known to be used, were scored at 0.5 times the tabulated values.
(source: US FWS)

examples.value: Chlorophyll-a content from the filters is done fluorimetrically using EPA method 445 (Arar, E.J. and G.B. Collins. 1997. In vitro determination of chlorophyll a and pheophytin a in marine and freshwater algae by fluorescence. NERL Document #445.0-1). Chlorophyll a was extracted overnight in a freezer in 90% acetone, and read on a Turner Designs TD100 fluorometer before and after acidification. All sample operations were done in a darkened room, and the fluorometer was calibrated annually with standards obtained from Turner Designs.

The source data set (Smith 1991) provides 467 weekly images of each of the nine regions of the world oceans; these weekly files were averages in the present dataset to provide monthly composite images. Calculate monthly averages and composite monthly averages. The included C-language programs sum.c and combine.c were used to calculate the monthly and weekly average SST files. For each grid cell in the images, sum.c calculates the arithmetic average of the corresponding cell in the input files for each month or week of the year. Results are written to a set of intermediate files which are interpreted by combine c. The program combine decodes the intermediate files written by sum and writes each average image into a new files. Create GIF and PICT images of month and weekly averages. The C-language program mrletoppm.c converts a monthly or weekly average file into a portable pixmap. GIF and PICT images were derived from these pixmpas using the freely available PbmPlus toolkit developed by Jeff Poskanzer.

examples.value: This marine water temperature data set is a component of the benthic monitoring portion of the GulfWatch Alaska (GWA) program. The Exxon Valdez Oil Spill Trustee Council and state and federal agencies are supporting a five-year, $12 million long-term monitoring program in the Gulf of Alaska region affected by the 1989 Exxon Valdez oil spill. The monitoring program, called GulfWatch, includes 25 principal scientists and seeks to provide data to identify and help understand the impacts of multiple ecosystem factors on the recovery of injured resources. This program is expected to be 20 years in total length, but planned and funded in five-year increments. It builds upon the past 23 years of restoration research and monitoring by the EVOSTC and federal and state agencies. Monitoring efforts will span a range of species and marine conditions, organized in three components, with integrated data management and synthesis of science information provided across the components. The program includes sites in Prince William Sound, lower Cook Inlet and the outer Kenai Peninsula coast. Environmental Drivers component – oceanography, plankton Benthic component – intertidal invertebrate, algae, sea otters, seabirds, lingering oil Pelagic component – whales, seabirds, forage fish.

abstract.label: Abstract

examples.value: This data is part of the Gulf Watch Alaska (GWA) long term monitoring program, nearshore monitoring component. Specifically, these data describe mussel sampling and observations conducted in the northern Gulf of Alaska within the GWA program. The dataset consists of five comma separated files exported from a microsoft excel workbook. The data consists of 1. mussel sampling site layout information, 2. mussel count and 3. size measurements for mussels greater than 20 millimeters, 4. mussel count and 5. size measurements for all mussels collected from core samples. Samplers used transect tapes, quadrat frames, rulers, and core tools to sample mussels from mussel sites. Mussels greater than 20 millimeters were collected from a quadrat and measured with dial calipers to the nearest millimeter. Associated with the quadrat, but not within it, a small core sample was collected and all mussels greater than 1mm were counted and measured (measurements began in 2014). Sampling year, region, block, site, quadrat number, quardrat size (overall area sampled), and number of mussels in the core were recorded. Sites are in Alaska and include locations in Katmai National Park and Preserve, Kenai Fjords National Park and Prince William Sound. There are five mussel sites in each of those three regions. The time interval includes 2008-2015. Pacific blue mussels (Mytilus trossulus) are a conspicuous and abundant filter feeding marine invertebrate in the intertidal zone. Mussels are widely distributed, but also form relatively monotypic stands of larger individuals that are termed mussel beds. Although a number of factors such as environment, disturbance, predation and competition influence the abundance and distribution of mussels, they can be a competitively dominant intertidal species. Within the nearshore foodweb, mussels area a source of energy to a wide array of invertebrate, avian, and mammalian predators and are critically important prey for sea otters, black oystercatchers, harlequin ducks, Barrows goldeneye, and several species of sea stars.

purpose.label: Purpose
purpose.help_text: The intention of the dataset and why it was collected or developed, as well as a statement about the dataset's relevance to any larger project or effort.

examples.value: The purpose of this task is to assess change in the density and size distribution of mussels (Mytilus trossulus) in mussel beds. These data are primarily to be used as an indicator of mussel prey for various predators, including sea otters, black oystercatchers, sea ducks and sea stars. Specifically, the objectives of this task are to assess changes in: 1) the size (area) of selected mussel beds, 2) the density of mussels within these beds, and 3) the size distribution of mussels within the beds.

The data provide consultants, planners, and resource managers with information on wetland location and type. The data were collected to meet U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service's mandate to map the wetland and deep water habitats of the United States.

attribute_accuracy.label: Attribute Accuracy Report

examples.value: Attribute accuracy was tested by manual comparison with hard copy printouts and/or symbolized display of the digital wetlands data on an interactive computer graphic system. In addition, WAMS software (USFWS-NWI) was used to test the attributes against a master set of valid wetland attributes.|We carry out a standard QAQC procedure for this data. Rows are checked against field data sheets for missing values, outliers, and inconsistencies. Mussel size data are entered electronically in the field, rather than being recorded on datasheets. Mussels are held until verification is received that the spreadsheet has been saved.

consistency.label: Data Consistency Report
consistency.help_text: The quality control measures that were taken in the creation of this dataset to verify the logical validity and consistency of all data values.

examples.value: Verification of valid values based on collection site

QA/QC procedures for this data are being developed. The logger deployed in Nuka Bay from June 2013 to June 2014 returned temperatures approximately 3 degrees Centigrade lower than the loggers deployed at the same site immediately before and after it. In our use of the data we have corrected this by adding 3.31 degrees to all the temperature readings for that time span. Other users may opt to delete the data or calculate their own correction. Note that for future deployments (not in this data collection) we are testing the calibration of loggers prior to deployment and if they are off by more than the factory specifications, not deploying the logger.

completeness.label: Completeness Report
completeness.help_text: Information about any data omissions, inclusion or exclusion criteria, generalizations, definitions used, and other rules used to derive the dataset.

examples.value: Completeness statement and critieria for inclusion

Often, a mussel is damaged during collection and cannot be properly measured. Size is entered as a null value, but the entry is necessary for correct counts. Counts of zero have been entered in the database and are included in this dataset. No data does not equal a count of zero. Null values in count tables indicate a quad or core was not sampled. Zero means there were no mussels in the quad or core. In 2011 no sampling was conducted at the five sites in KATM. WPWS sampling did not begin until 2010. EPWS and NPWS were each only sampled two times in alternating years.
In some years instruments were lost, not deployed, or at times failed so there are gaps in data when any of these occurred.
Bathymetric data at 20 meter resolution is not suitable for navigation purposes.

codeListValues.label: Discipline
codeListValues.description: Branch of instruction or specialized learning

codeListValues.label: Place
codeListValues.description: A location

codeListValues.label: Stratum
codeListValues.description: The layer(s) of any deposited substance or levels within an ordered system

codeListValues.label: Temporal
codeListValues.description: Time period(s) related to the dataset

codeListValues.label: Theme
codeListValues.description: A particular subject or topic

codeListValues.label: Data Center
codeListValues.description: A repository or archive that manages the data

codeListValues.label: Feature Type
codeListValues.description: Feature instance types present in a geospatial resource

codeListValues.label: Instrument
codeListValues.description: A device used to measure or compare physical properties

codeListValues.label: Platform
codeListValues.description: A structure on which an instrument is mounted

codeListValues.label: Process
codeListValues.description: A series of actions or natural occurrences

codeListValues.label: Product
codeListValues.description: a Type of product

codeListValues.label: Project
codeListValues.description: An endeavor undertaken to create or modify a product or service

codeListValues.label: Service
codeListValues.description: An activity carried out by one party for the benefit of another

codeListValues.label: Continual
codeListValues.description: Data is repeatedly and frequently updated

codeListValues.label: Daily
codeListValues.description: Data is updated each day

codeListValues.label: Weekly
codeListValues.description: Data is updated on a weekly basis

codeListValues.label: Bi-weekly
codeListValues.description: Data is updated every two weeks

codeListValues.label: Monthly
codeListValues.description: Data is updated every month

codeListValues.label: Quarterly
codeListValues.description: Data is updated every three months

codeListValues.label: Biannually
codeListValues.description: Data is updated every six months

codeListValues.label: Annually
codeListValues.description: Data is updated every year

codeListValues.label: As Needed
codeListValues.description: Data is updated as deemed necessary

codeListValues.label: Irregularly
codeListValues.description: Data is updated in intervals that are uneven in duration

codeListValues.label: Not Planned
codeListValues.description: There are no plans to update the data

codeListValues.label: Unknown
codeListValues.description: Frequency of maintenance for the data is unknown

codeListValues.label: Completed
codeListValues.description: Production of the dataset has been completed or the project lifespan has ended

codeListValues.label: Archived
codeListValues.description: Data has been stored in an offline storage facility

codeListValues.label: Obsolete
codeListValues.description: Project or data is no longer relevant

codeListValues.label: Ongoing
codeListValues.description: Data is continually being updated or project lifespan has not ended

codeListValues.label: Planned
codeListValues.description: A date has been fixed by which the data will be created or updated

codeListValues.label: Required
codeListValues.description: Data needs to be generated or updated

codeListValues.label: Under Development
codeListValues.description: Data is currently in the process of being created or project is being executed

codeListValues.label: Final
codeListValues.description: Project or data processing concluded and no changes will be accepted

codeListValues.label: Pending
codeListValues.description: Committed to, but not yet addressed

codeListValues.label: Retired
codeListValues.description: Resource is no longer recommended for use

codeListValues.label: Superceded
codeListValues.description: Resource has been replaced by a newer resource

codeListValues.label: Tentative
codeListValues.description: Provisional changes are likely before the resource if final or becomes complete

codeListValues.label: Valid
codeListValues.description: Data is considered acceptable under specific conditions

codeListValues.label: Accepted
codeListValues.description: Data or final project status has been accepted by the sponsor

codeListValues.label: Not Accepted
codeListValues.description: Data or final project status has been rejected by the sponsor

codeListValues.label: Withdrawn
codeListValues.description: Removed from consideration

codeListValues.label: Proposed
codeListValues.description: Project or dataset has been suggested for development

codeListValues.label: Deprecated
codeListValues.description: Resource superceded and will become obsolete

codeListValues.label: Copyright
codeListValues.description: Exclusive right to the publication, production, or sale of the rights to a literary, dramatic, musical, or artistic work, or to the use of a commercial print or label, granted by law for a specified period of time to an author, composer, artist, distributor

codeListValues.label: Patent
codeListValues.description: Government has granted exclusive right to make, sell, use or license an invention or discovery

codeListValues.label: Patent Pending
codeListValues.description: Produced or sold information awaiting a patent

codeListValues.label: Trademark
codeListValues.description: A name, symbol, or other device identifying a product, officially registered and legally restricted to the use of the owner or manufacturer

codeListValues.label: License
codeListValues.description: Formal permission to do something

codeListValues.label: Intellectual Property Rights
codeListValues.description: Rights to financial benefit from and control of distribution of non-tangible property that is a result of creativity

codeListValues.label: Restricted
codeListValues.description: Withheld from general circulation or disclosure

codeListValues.label: Other Restrictions
codeListValues.description: Limitation not listed

codeListValues.label: Unrestricted
codeListValues.description: No constraints exist

codeListValues.label: License Unrestricted
codeListValues.description: Formal permissions not required to use the resource

codeListValues.label: License End User
codeListValues.description: Formal permission required for a person or an entity to use the resource and that may differ from the person that orders or purchases it

codeListValues.label: License Distributor
codeListValues.description: Formal permission required for a person or an entity to commercialize or distribute the resource

codeListValues.label: Private
codeListValues.description: Protects rights of individual or organization from observation, intrusion, or attention of others

codeListValues.label: Statutory
codeListValues.description: Prescribed by law

codeListValues.label: Confidential
codeListValues.description: Not available to the public, contains information that could be prejudicial to a commercial, industrial, or national interest

codeListValues.label: SBU
codeListValues.description: Unclassified, yet requires strict controls over its distribuition

codeListValues.label: In Confidence
codeListValues.description: With Trust

codeListValues.label: Vector
codeListValues.description: Vector data used to represent geographic data

codeListValues.label: Grid
codeListValues.description: Grid data used to represent geographic data

codeListValues.label: Text table
codeListValues.description: Textual or tabular data used to represent geogrpahic data

codeListValues.label: TIN
codeListValues.description: Triangulated Irregular Network

codeListValues.label: Stereo model
codeListValues.description: 3-dimensional view formed by the intersecting homologous rays of an overlapping pair of images

codeListValues.label: Video
codeListValues.description: Scene from a video recording

codeListValues.label: Farming
codeListValues.description: rearing of animals and/or cultivation of plants. Examples: agriculture, irrigation, aquaculture, plantations, herding, pests and diseases affecting crops and livestock

codeListValues.label: Biota
codeListValues.description: flora and/or fauna in natural environment. Examples: wildlife, vegetation, biological sciences, ecology, wilderness, sealife, wetlands, habitat

codeListValues.label: Boundaries
codeListValues.description: legal land descriptions. Examples: political and administrative boundaries

codeListValues.label: Climate Meteorology or Atmosphere
codeListValues.description: processes and phenomena of the atmosphere. Examples: cloud cover, weather, climate, atmospheric conditions, climate change, precipitation

codeListValues.label: Economy
codeListValues.description: economic activities, conditions and employment. Examples: production, labour, revenue, commerce, industry, tourism and ecotourism, forestry, fisheries, commercial or subsistence hunting, exploration and exploitation of resources such as minerals, oil and gas

codeListValues.label: Elevation
codeListValues.description: height above or below sea level. Examples: altitude, bathymetry, digital elevation models, slope, derived products

codeListValues.label: Environment
codeListValues.description: environmental resources, protection and conservation. Examples: environmental pollution, waste storage and treatment, environmental impact assessment, monitoring environmental risk, nature reserves, landscape

codeListValues.label: Geoscientific Information
codeListValues.description: information pertaining to earth sciences. Examples: geophysical features and processes, geology, minerals, sciences dealing with the composition, structure and origin of the earth s rocks, risks of earthquakes, volcanic activity, landslides, gravity information, soils, permafrost, hydrogeology, erosion

codeListValues.label: Health
codeListValues.description: health, health services, human ecology, and safety. Examples: disease and illness, factors affecting health, hygiene, substance abuse, mental and physical health, health services

codeListValues.label: Imagery Base Maps and Earth Cover
codeListValues.description: base maps. Examples: land cover, topographic maps, imagery, unclassified images, annotations

codeListValues.label: Intelligence or Military
codeListValues.description: military bases, structures, activities. Examples: barracks, training grounds, military transportation, information collection

codeListValues.label: Inland Waters
codeListValues.description: inland water features, drainage systems and their characteristics. Examples: rivers and glaciers, salt lakes, water utilization plans, dams, currents, floods, water quality, hydrographic charts

codeListValues.label: Location
codeListValues.description: positional information and services. Examples: addresses, geodetic networks, control points, postal zones and services, place names

codeListValues.label: Oceans
codeListValues.description: features and characteristics of salt water bodies (excluding inland waters). Examples: tides, tidal waves, coastal information, reefs

codeListValues.label: Planning Cadastre
codeListValues.description: information used for appropriate actions for future use of the land. Examples: land use maps, zoning maps, cadastral surveys, land ownership

codeListValues.label: Society
codeListValues.description: characteristics of society and cultures. Examples: settlements, anthropology, archaeology, education, traditional beliefs, manners and customs, demographic data, recreational areas and activities, social impact assessments, crime and justice, census information

codeListValues.label: Structure
codeListValues.description: man-made construction. Examples: buildings, museums, churches, factories, housing, monuments, shops, towers

codeListValues.label: Transportation
codeListValues.description: means and aids for conveying persons and/or goods. Examples: roads, airports/airstrips, shipping routes, tunnels, nautical charts, vehicle or vessel location, aeronautical charts, railways

codeListValues.label: Utilities and Communication
codeListValues.description: energy, water and waste systems and communications infrastructure and services. Examples: hydroelectricity, geothermal, solar and nuclear sources of energy, water purification and distribution, sewage collection and disposal, electricity and gas distribution, data communication, telecommunication, radio, communication networks

codeListValues.label: Extraterrestrial
codeListValues.description: region more than 100 km above the surface of the earth

codeListValues.label: Disaster
codeListValues.description: Information related to disasters. Examples: site of the disaster, evacuation zone, disaster-prevention facility, disaster relief activities

codeListValues.description: Information applies to the collection session

codeListValues.description: Information applies to the dataset

codeListValues.description: Information applies to the series

codeListValues.label: Dimension Group
codeListValues.description: Information applies to a dimension group

codeListValues.description: Information applies to a feature type

codeListValues.description: Information applies to a property type

codeListValues.label: Field Session
codeListValues.description: Information applies to a field session

codeListValues.label: Software
codeListValues.description: Information applies to a computer program or routine

codeListValues.label: Model
codeListValues.description: Information applies to a copy or imitation of an existing or hypothetical object

codeListValues.label: Tile
codeListValues.description: Information applies to a tile, a spatial subset of geographic data

codeListValues.description: The referencing entity applies to a transfer aggregate which has an existence outside of the transfer context, but which does not pertains to a specific aggregate type.

codeListValues.label: Image Hardcopy
codeListValues.description: Likeness of natural or man-made features, objects, and activities acquired through the sensing of visual or any other segment of the electromagnetic spectrum by sensors, such as thermal infrared, and high resolution radar and reproduced on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

codeListValues.description: Map represented in raster or vector form

codeListValues.label: Map Hardcopy
codeListValues.description: Map printed on paper, photographic material, or other media for use directly by the human user

codeListValues.description: Multi-dimensional digital representation of a feature, process, etc.

codeListValues.label: Model Hardcopy
codeListValues.description: 3-dimensional, physical model

codeListValues.description: Vertical cross-section in digital form

codeListValues.description: Representation of facts or figures systematically displayed, especially in columns, printed onpapers, photographic material, or other media

codeListValues.description: Audio recording delivered by analog media, such as a magnetic tape

codeListValues.label: Multimedia Digital
codeListValues.description: Information representation using simultaneously various digital modes for text, sound, image

codeListValues.label: Multimedia Hardcopy
codeListValues.description: Information representation using simultaneously various analog modes for text, sound, image

codeListValues.description: A physical object, e.g. Rock or mineral sample, microscope slide

codeListValues.description: Information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart, and other type of diagrams and recorded in digital format

codeListValues.label: Diagram Hardcopy
codeListValues.description: Information represented graphically by charts such as pie chart, bar chart, and other type of diagrams and printed on paper, phototographic material, or other media

codeListValues.label: Platform

codeListValues.label: Process

codeListValues.label: Program
codeListValues.description: Specific planned activity

codeListValues.label: Project
codeListValues.description: Organized undertaking, research, or development

codeListValues.label: Study

codeListValues.label: Task
